parts.text:
```json
{
"application": "Spack",
"details": {
"scheduler": "Slurm",
"job_name": "plumed@2.6.3",
"account": "sys200",
"partition": "hotel-gpu",
"nodes": 1,
"tasks_per_node": 1,
"cpus_per_task": 8,
"gpu": "gpu1",
"time": "01:00:00",
"output": "%x.o%j.%N",
"spack_version": "0.17.3",
"spack_instance_name": "gpu",
"spack_instance_dir": "/cm/shared/apps/spack/0.17.3/gpu",
"spack_package": "plumed@2.6.3",
"spack_compiler": "gcc@10.2.0",
"spack_variants": "+gsl +mpi +shared",
"spack_dependencies": "^openblas@0.3.17/$(spack find --format '{hash:7}' openblas@0.3.17 % ${SPACK_COMPILER} ~ilp64 threads=none) ^openmpi@4.1.3/$(spack find --format '{hash:7}' openmpi@4.1.3 % ${SPACK_COMPILER}) ^python@3.8.12/$(spack find --format '{hash:7}' python@3.8.12 % ${SPACK_COMPILER})",
"spack_spec": "plumed@2.6.3 % gcc@10.2.0 +gsl +mpi +shared ^openblas@0.3.17/$(spack find --format '{hash:7}' openblas@0.3.17 % ${SPACK_COMPILER} ~ilp64 threads=none) ^openmpi@4.1.3/$(spack find --format '{hash:7}' openmpi@4.1.3 % ${SPACK_COMPILER}) ^python@3.8.12/$(spack find --format '{hash:7}' python@3.8.12 % ${SPACK_COMPILER})"
}
}
```

This script uses **Spack** as its primary application. Spack is a package manager for scientific software. This script utilizes Spack to install the **Plumed** package, version 2.6.3, using the **gcc** compiler version 10.2.0. It sets up Plumed with the **+gsl +mpi +shared** variants and specifies dependencies on **openblas**, **openmpi**, and **python**. The script leverages **Slurm** as the job scheduler,  utilizes a specific account, partition, and node configuration for resource allocation. After installing Plumed, the script submits another job for **Gromacs** (version 2020.4) with a dependency on the successful completion of the current job.
